intro: Gilia tenuiflora var. altissima, commonly known as the tall gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, bright pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This species is often found in open plains and grasslands, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
